page.title: 18FARMING TECHNOLOGY: ACTON
page.content: Computers are used on larger farms for day-to-day running e.g. wages, accounts, crop records, date of seed planting, chemicals applied, seed treatment required, date of harvesting, returns per acre, where and when sold, price received. Owners of computers belong to a Syndicate of Agronomists with a link to the National Union of Farmers. Small farms have access to a computer but in the main keep records by hand. With the advent of machinery on arable land, cultivation is no longer labour intensive. For example, on 3000 acres 20 full time workers are supplemented by 6 part timers at har- vest. Crops are generally sprayed at ground level but occasionally by air. Aerial spraying is by contract labour.
